ai-tha-ap419:0.3_0: The Elders questioned (them) in order to give a gift to the Elders,
ai-tha-ap419:1.2_0: Mātali, I fell at that very sad:
ai-tha-ap419:1.4_0: went to the middle of the day.
ai-tha-ap419:2.1_0: At that time the Fortunate One
ai-tha-ap419:2.2_0: at the fore of the mendicant Saṅgha,
ai-tha-ap419:2.3_0: by the power of a great (supernatural) power,
ai-tha-ap419:2.4_0: which leads out to the world.
ai-tha-ap419:3.1_0: Seeing the light of the world,
ai-tha-ap419:4.2_0: As a bird was worshipped by the flowers,
ai-tha-ap419:4.3_0: I’m not aware of any living creatures.
ai-tha-ap419:6.1_0: It was so welcome for me
ai-tha-ap419:8.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Aṅgaka.
ai-tha-ap419:9.1_0: the thirteen flowers to the Elders.
